utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Tell me, seer, what do I hold in my hand now? Shh.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You're holding... A wallet.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes! Incredible. Ten out of ten.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gram's teaching me how to read minds.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And she is a natural. Much better than you were at her age.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I'm very proud. Why the sudden foray into the mysterious realms?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It's a genealogy project for school. Half of the assignment is to collect stories from family members. I had no idea that Gram's folks had a mind-reading act on Coney Island.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah, they were very famous in their day.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I love all their codes-- how "tell me" means wallet and "reveal to me" means a pair of glasses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, you come from a long line of hucksters and charlatans, myself included. But we have high hopes for you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That must be Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you know?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It's after 10:00 on a weekday. Who else is it gonna be?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, she is good.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Brilliant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Castle. I knew it was you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Victim is a Hispanic male, mid-30s. A local spotted him when he was out walking his dog, around 10:30. His wallet's missing. If it was a robbery, I bet my week's salary that the killer didn't know who he was rolling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You I.D.'ed him without a wallet?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Unfortunately.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know the guy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Everybody in New York knows the guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cano Vega, the baseball player.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cano Vega? Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He was my first-round draft pick in my fantasy league three years running. .314 batting average, 4 gold gloves, and one... championship ring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I almost caught one of his homers once. He had just came to the States from Cuba, and my dad took us out to the bleachers over at Shea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn't know you were a baseball fan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's genetic, on my dad's side. He’s been taking me to games since I was 3.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, mine, too. What about you, Castle? Your dad a baseball fan?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I really can't say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle is famously fatherless.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What, are you adopted or something?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then how do you--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's complicated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Time of death?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What's with all this bruising?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Pitching arm-- It ran for a while after he was dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you'd think a guy like Cano Vega would have a batting cage in his basement. What would he be doing in a sketchy neighbourhood in Spanish Harlem at this hour of the night?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe because it's Cano Vega Field. Local uniforms said that he built it for the community, wanted to give something back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So our killer hit him from here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And he got blood on his shoe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have C.S.U. run a sweep. See if anything tracked outside of the field.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. So your dad, what is it, a Mamma Mia! thing? Early '70s, free love. Yeah, I'll bet your mom was kinda wild back in the day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You really need to stop talking now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sorry. Done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A big, athletic guy is swinging a 2-1/2-foot club. He couldn't have been that easy to kill.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless he didn't see it coming.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY FOX
utterance.content: On behalf of the Vega family... I want to thank all of Cano's loyal fans for their love and support. In this time of great sadness, we ask that you please respect his family's privacy.

utterance.speaker: REPORTER
utterance.content: Mr. Fox, who else is...

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE VEGA
utterance.content: 12 years of marriage-- All they want from me is a sound bite.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm very sorry about your loss, Mrs. Vega. Do you know why he'd be in the park last night?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Sometimes he'd go there to blow off steam, but never at night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know where he was earlier in the evening?

utterance.speaker: TOMMY ZANE
utterance.content: He was at my club.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, Mr. Castle, Tommy Zane-- Cano's old teammate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Be hard to be a New Yorker and not know Freight Train Tommy Zane.

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: So you guys got any leads?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We're looking into it. Mr. Zane, you said that Mr. Vega was at your club last night?

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: Our club, actually. Cano and I owned it with a couple of other players.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know about what time?

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: Dropped by about 7:00. Left about 7:30. I didn't really see him. I was with a friend. Excuse me. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Vega, do you know of anyone who would've wanted to hurt your husband?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Used to be, everybody loved him, especially in the Cuban community.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What changed?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: The trip. A-a few months ago, the Cuban tourism department approached him. They wanted Cano to be the poster boy for the new Cuba.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You risk your life to escape Castro's Cuba, why would you go back to visit?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: While Cano was down there, the locals treated him like a hero-- their hero. At a state dinner, Castro came over and shook his hand. When he got home, his friends called him a traitor for going, said he was a lapdog for Fidel. The same people who cheered when he built that ballpark came up and told him to go to hell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he get any threats?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY FOX
utterance.content: You bet he got threats, hundreds of them, and all of them courtesy of Alfredo Quintana.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Detective, Bobby Fox, Cano's agent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: Detective, could you do something to get those jackals and their cameras away from Mrs. Vega's house?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'll see what I can do.

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who's Alfredo Quintana?

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: He's the guy who killed Cano Vega.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks, Carlos. Hey. Alfredo Quintana-- J.D., Ph.D. and editor of Una Nueva Esperanza, a newspaper published by his foundation, primarily for the Cuban community. This is his column from two weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: "Cano Vega must pay"?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The article's about how Vega betrayed the Cuban community by shaking hands with the monster who butchered thousands of their relatives. Quintana says, "If Vega is going to embrace the brutal regime he once escaped, he would do well to be reminded of its barbarous cruelty."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that sounds like a threat to me.

utterance.speaker: QUINTANA
utterance.content: I wasn't threatening him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You turned the local Cuban community against him.

utterance.speaker: QUINTANA
utterance.content: He turned his back on his people when he gave Castro his nod of approval. If you want me to be sorry about what I wrote because he's dead, I'm not. I wrote the truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure that's all you did? You said it yourself in your editorial, Vega should pay.

utterance.speaker: QUINTANA
utterance.content: It's a free country, isn't it? I'm entitled to express my opinion.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your foundation-- Cubans First-- is on East 98th Street. That's three blocks away from the field where Vega's body was found.

utterance.speaker: QUINTANA
utterance.content: You think I had something to do with his murder?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the pen is mightier than the sword. But a baseball bat can be pretty effective, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night between 7:00 and 10:00 pm?

utterance.speaker: QUINTANA
utterance.content: I was at home with my wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mm. Wives make such convenient alibis.

utterance.speaker: QUINTANA
utterance.content: My sons were there as well... as well as my brother.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you have anyone who isn't blood related? A notary, perhaps?

utterance.speaker: QUINTANA
utterance.content: Look, what Cano Vega did is inexcusable. But I am not a murderer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure about that, Mr. Quintana? You incited an entire community against him. So from where I'm standing, you might not have swung that bat, but that doesn't mean that you didn't kill him.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We'll check his alibi... but my gut tells me it's not him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We should get a warrant, run his subscribers against any hate mail that the Vegas might have gotten.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You sure you got no cop in the Castle family tree?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, us Castles are mostly con artists and circus folk, sir.

utterance.speaker: MONTGROMERY
utterance.content: No, I think there's a little cop in there somewhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Con artists and circus people, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yep, and mind readers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? So tell me what I'm thinking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aah. You're... You're thinking... You don't care and you want me to stop talking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ooh, that's uncanny.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's in the blood.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just got back from C.S.U. They managed to track the blood trail from the killer's shoe across the park. It dead-ended at the curb.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So our killer was driving a car.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. The area was a little muddy, so we were able to pull a partial on the tire.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any make and model?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Better. The tire marks are distinctive. They've been patched in two spots. Now those same tire tracks match a car that was tagged in an aggravated assault last year. The assault was committed with a baseball bat by one Anton Wade.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Loan sharking, blackmail.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Plus assault with a deadly weapon and two A_B's— Assault and battery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right. The guy's one seriously bad dude.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa! Whoa, whoa, whoa. Oh, I'm sensing something here-- that... this guy might just be our killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Wade, we have you at the baseball field. Your car was at the crime scene, not to mention your unfortunate history of hitting people with baseball bats. All of that's enough to send you away. So... you can play dumb or you can play ball.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pun intended.

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: All right, I was there, but I didn't kill him. He was already dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were just paying the corpse a visit.

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: He called and asked me to meet up with him. And when I got there, I knew how it looked. So I bounced the hell up outta there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would Vega call you?

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: He wanted to make a payment on his loan. He always paid the same way, cash in a plain envelope. I saw it on him. I took it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The guy's a multimillionaire. You're a petty loan shark. What's he doing borrowing money from you?

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: In my business, you don't ask, you don't tell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How much money did he borrow?

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: He came to me a couple weeks back, needed 200 grand. In my experience... if you need that kind of coin, he got himself into some real bad... trouble-- The kind of trouble that gets you killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe he couldn't pay your vig.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you pulled a little Untouchables De Niro on his head.

utterance.speaker: WADE
utterance.content: A guy owing you money? Killing him ain't gonna get you paid. You take his bling, you jack him for his ride, you maybe even bust his kneecaps. But he made his last instalment. Vega made his vig. We were good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vega's wife didn't know anything about the 200 grand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It doesn't make sense. With his assets, a guy like Cano Vega could get a loan from any bank in New York City. So why go to a loan shark for $200,000?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Because bank loans take time. Loan sharks give it to you right away. Maybe he needed the money fast.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he needed it kept quiet. Loan sharks don't require paperwork, credit checks. Maybe he didn't want his wife to know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vega didn't want his wife to know why he was going to Cuba either.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: So you think his trip and the money are related?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, a week after he gets back, he suddenly needs $200,000? It stands to reason that the two were connected somehow.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. We just finished a search of Wade's apartment. We found a match to the partial shoe print.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but here's the weird thing-- it tested positive for blood on the sole, but negative for blood on the rest of the shoe and negative for cleaning agents.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Wade killed Vega, then his shoe would've been covered in blood.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Wade's telling the truth. He shows up after the murder, tracks some blood

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: While the real murderer gets blood on top of his shoe and leaves little or no trail behind.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Let's find out why Vega comes back from Cuba and suddenly needs 200 grand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So where do you want to start?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys look into Vega's financials. See if we missed anything. Castle and I will start with Cuba.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cuba. Good idea. I'll bring the mojitos. You get the beach towels.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I don't know, Castle. Me in a swimsuit under the hot, blistering sun?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'd be happy to rub lotion on you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's okay. I was actually thinking of something a little bit more local... Like the man who arranged the entire trip to Cuba. Bobby Fox, his agent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's a good idea. But the lotion offer still stands.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have very soft hands.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is it with professional sports? I mean, even the agencies are on steroids.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, Fox's client list is a veritable who's who of star athletes. 5% of their endorsements and salaries-- You could pay for half of lower Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you just use the word "veritable"?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, I did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sexy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You should hear me say "fallacious."

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Bobby Fox Agency. Please hold. Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need to see Mr. Fox.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Do you have an appointment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think he can squeeze me in.

utterance.speaker: JOE TORRE
utterance.content: Rick? Rick Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Skipper. I have not seen you since the big move. How are you, Joe?

utterance.speaker: TORRE
utterance.content: Pretty awful. I just can't believe this whole Vega thing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know. It's sad. And you two were friends. I'm-- I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: TORRE
utterance.content: Yeah, he was a great kid. Uh, he had the ability to be a Cuban Roberto Clemente. It's just been very sad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We're actually here to talk to Mr. Fox about it. This is Detective Kate Beckett.

utterance.speaker: TORRE
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett... Kate... Detective. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: TORRE
utterance.content: Very nice meeting you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: TORRE
utterance.content: Well, good luck on the case. And, uh, I'll say a prayer for you guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: TORRE
utterance.content: By the way, say hi to your mom for me, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Will do, Joe.

utterance.speaker: TORRE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Smooth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was Joe-freakin'-Torre. I gotta call my dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The office is over... The off-- his office is...

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: He was a good guy--Cano. He built that field because he wanted to give back. I think that's why he went to Cuba. He wanted to see if he could do something good. But I guess things hadn't changed as much as he had hoped for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: He had spent some time in Havana with the people. He came back pretty upset, and he told me to give the tourism guys back their signing bonus. First time I ever let a client give money back. But I figured, you know, Cano was reneging on a military dictatorship. These are not the people you want angry at you, especially having defected from them 18 years ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He risked his life to leave. Why would you want him to be the poster boy for the new Cuba?

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: Oh, I didn't. I was just as surprised as anyone that he wanted to do it. After everything I did to get him out back then? Have you heard this story?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: You're gonna like this, Castle. It's like one of your books. It was the '92 Olympics. The Cubans had just won gold in Barcelona, thanks mostly to Cano. And I wanted to get him to the States to play in the bigs. Now convincing him was the easy part. Getting him onto my plane, that was the hard part. We had to get past coaches and minders and finally... El pulpo, Head of State Security, because he had his tentacles around everybody. And just as we thought we were home free-- boom! El pulpo. We were caught, sunk. A firing squad, I kid you not, was waiting for that kid back in Havana. You know how I got us past El pulpo? Rolex. I gave him my shiny new Rolex, and he just looked the other way. Just goes to show you, every socialist is a capitalist when backs are turned.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it possible that he took the Cuba job because he needed the money?

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: Well, it's possible, yes. God knows those guys know how to blow through money and plus, he has that club with Tommy that's just a money pit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So in regards to the Cuba job, who else went on this trip?

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: Well, a couple of low-level Cuban diplomats. I'll have, uh, Cynthia get you a list.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what made him go to Cuba and then what made him change his mind?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe Vega worked for the state department. Maybe he was sent to shake hands with Fidel in a secret attempt to release a biotoxin into his system. Well, the Russians sprayed sushi with radioactive polonium. What-- what's more farfetched?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I just met Joe Torre, so I guess anything's possible. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Cause of death was cerebral haemorrhaging, as expected.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any way to estimate the height of the attacker based on the angle of the blows?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Normally, yes, but I-in this case, your attacker's first swing landed a little south of his head.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How far south?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: E-enough to make him a soprano.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow. Shoulda worn a cup.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Lacerations around the patella suggest Mr. Vega was on his knees when he was hit

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So our attacker could've been anyone?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Man, woman or child. But that's not why I called. Among all the fresh bruising, we also found significant sub dermal bruises that weren't quite as fresh. The contusions were all fist sized.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was in a fight.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Couple days ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's this shape right here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was wearing a ring.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Not just any ring. A championship ring.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Left-hand ring finger, just like his old teammate, Freight Train Tommy Zane.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You know, mom's family goes all the way back to the Mayflower.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What, her persecution complex is genetic?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, those are my genes you're talking about, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, look on the bright side. Now that you know you're genetically predisposed, you can seek early treatment, prevent future outbreaks.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Doesn't it bother you that you don't know who your dad is?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Why, does it bother you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It's like... I have this family tree, and there's a whole chunk of it missing. There's a whole part of my history that doesn't even exist. I mean, really, how could gram not know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My first year of college, I, uh, went to a party, met this girl-- Allison. In the space of six hours, we met, we talked, we danced, we fell in love. The next morning, she was gone. utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: Let--let me get this straight. An illegal claiming to be Cano Vega's daughter, after being in this country for less than 24 hours, identifies someone who kind of looks like me from a distance at night? Well, gee, guys. What, do I-- What, do I sign my confession right now or after the big, uh, press conference?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, now's good.

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: Come on, kids. Come on. You know he was my friend. Not to mention a hefty commission. What's my motive?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The thing about people who have a lot, Mr. Fox, is that they have the most to lose. I'm sure Vega felt betrayed when he learned the truth.

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: The truth? About what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your favourite story-- Barcelona, 1992. Only you left out the part where you lied to Cano Vega about helping his fiancée to defect.

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: It's not my fault that she changed her mind, all right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Truth is, you couldn't get her off the island. But you did know that he'd rather be there with her than here making big bucks for you in the majors.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you let him believe that she had changed her mind. And to keep him from ever finding out the truth, you had her put away.

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: Put away? In Cuba? Oh, come on. I-I have a lot of pull, but, uh, influencing a military dictatorship isn't as easy as getting a dinner reservation at Le Cirque.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You'd influenced their people before. Manuel Gutierrez, A.K.A. El pulpo-- The octopus. You walked away with the star player of the Cuban national team for a Rolex.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We did a little research. He was the chief witness at her trial.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was denouncing Vega's fiancé always a part of your plan with el pulpo or did you have to pay extra for that? I've heard you're a killer negotiator.

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: You can't possibly be serious.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When Vega figured out what you had done, he called you from his club and told you to meet him. I think he came after you and threatened to destroy you and that's why you killed him.

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: It's a hell of a story, kids. I paid el pulpo to take care of my player's girl when the Cuban government is sending away people every day? That's a hell of a tale. It's pure conjecture.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what's not conjecture? The blood that we found on the driver's side floor mat in your car. That was Vega's blood.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As much as you tried to clean those $5,000 pair of shoes you were wearing while you smashed Vega's skull in, you didn't quite get all of it.

utterance.speaker: FOX
utterance.content: Hello, Cynthia. Call my lawyer. You tell him he's about to earn the outrageous, obscene amounts of money I pay him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Turn around. Turn around. Robert Fox, you're under arrest for the murder of Cano Vega.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's gonna happen to Lara?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She can stay in the States for a year, and then decide whether she wants to apply for citizenship or not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I can't imagine her staying. Her last bit of family is gone. I mean, the only person that she knew here is dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, there is one more person that she should meet.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: So you're Lara?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was born in Cuba right after Mr. Vega defected.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She's not his girlfriend. She's his daughter.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Cano had a daughter?

utterance.speaker: LARA
utterance.content: My father... didn't know how you would like to have me here. He, uh... he had fear to tell you about me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It's okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She says she knows her father loved you very much, and he didn't want to hurt you. And that she hoped and he hoped that, together, you could be a family.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Yo soy Maggie. Mi casa es su casa.

utterance.speaker: LARA
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, daughter. What are you doing up so late?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Waiting for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did I do something wrong?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. I was just thinking about what you said about your dad, how he could be anything you imagine him to be-- An astronaut or a pirate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whipped cream inventor.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Or whipped cream inventor. But there's one thing he can't be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: A dad. Just a regular dad, teaching his son how to ride a bike or helping him with homework or having a catch. It makes me sad you didn't get to have those things.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well... I can't miss what I didn't have.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What if you could have it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have a time machine behind the kitchen counter?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What do you say, son? How about a game of catch with your old man?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I'd like that.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You ready?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh...
